intro: Behenantha cserei, commonly known as the Hungarian nettle, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes stinging nettles, and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped with serrated edges and are covered in fine hairs that can cause skin irritation. Behenantha cserei is often found in moist, disturbed soils along roadsides and in woodland edges.
